item.title: Notes on passing AWS Solutions Architect exam
item.description: At the end of January 2019 I successfully passed AWS Solutions Architect Associate exam. Here are my notes on the preparation process and the exam itself.

item.title: Intel Xeon vs AMD EPYC
item.description: I was curious of how performant is the new AMD EPYC processor and did two practical tests:

item.title: Running the latest Linux kernel
item.description: When Meltdown and Spectre struck, it took Ubuntu a few days to release an updated kernel. It made me think if I could run the latest unmodified (vanilla) kernel from kernel.org and didn’t have to wait for the distribution to release their version.

item.title: How to build a debian package using Go
item.description: Here is a quick example of how to build a debian package programmatically.

item.title: Hcloud With Terraform
item.description:
Hetzner Cloud is an excellent cloud provider.

Here is a quick example of how to create a server on Hetzner Cloud using Terraform.

item.title: Secure and easy to use GnuPG setup
item.description: Using GnuPG requires balancing security against ease of use.

item.title: How to use a physical harddrive in VirtualBox
item.description: In some cases it might be very convinient to use a physical harddrive (USB stick, SD card, etc.) as a disk for a virtual machine. It is quite easy on Linux.

item.title: Slave of no one
item.description: Authors of redis have their hearts in the right place.
